options.text: "How dare they proclaim a mere mortal as a god!" snarls believer @@RANDOM_NAME@@, angrily pummelling your desk with @@HIS@@ fists, as puce-coloured veins throb in @@HIS@@ temples. "We need to teach them respect for the tenets of our religion: throw them in the cells and throw away the key." [[color=red]Must have prisons[/color]]
options.result: @@DEMONYMNOUNPLURAL@@ believe a soft answer turneth away wrath but punitive punishment is much more fun

options.text: "How dare they proclaim a mere mortal as a god!" snarls believer @@RANDOM_NAME@@, angrily pummelling your desk with @@HIS@@ fists, as puce-coloured veins throb in @@HIS@@ temples. "We need to teach them respect for the tenets of our religion: build some jails, throw them in the cells and throw away the key." [[color=blue]Must not have prisons[/color]]
options.result: @@DEMONYMNOUNPLURAL@@ believe a soft answer turneth away wrath but punitive punishment is much more fun

policiesAndNotabilities.full: removes notability: complete lack of prisons
policiesAndNotabilities.name: complete lack of prisons

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: restrictive gun laws
policiesAndNotabilities.name: restrictive gun laws

options.text: "Messy is almost as handsome a specimen as me!" opines your vain assistant @@RANDOMMALEAME@@, checking his most recent hairstyle in a mirror. "Launch a campaign, encouraging everyone to spend time and money on their personal grooming. We'd all be so preoccupied with ourselves we wouldn't notice, let alone worship, a false god."
options.result: vanity is the constant enemy of dignity

options.text: "This is too much trouble," sighs your secretary, as she slouches across her desk, ignoring some documents marked 'urgent'. "Let's face reality here: Messy is adored as a god and any action you take won't change that. Even after he retires from the game, he'll still be revered. Just save your energy; go with the flow and accept Messy's godlike... whatever."
options.result: "Idol-Worship for the Apathetic" workshops are cancelled when no-one bothers to show up

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

options.text: "Let's use this to make some money," grins well-dressed local minister @@RANDOM_NAME@@, who owns an incredibly expensive house. "We should invite this Messy person to our houses of prayer. His popularity will double the attendances, then we pass around extra large donation bags. We're going to make a fortune!"
options.result: most @@DEMONYMNOUNPLURAL@@ would sell their own grandmother

options.text: "Messy and the Albion always win everything, while we languish at the bottom of the table," pouts your brother, a fan of rival team @@CAPITAL@@ Wanderers F.C., as he weeps over last weekend's results. "Get some thugs to break his legs; finally end his godlike status AND his playing career. Then my beloved Wanderers might win something!"
options.result: other people's happiness is the biggest cause of @@DEMONYMADJECTIVE@@ unhappiness

options.text: "Messy is sooo dreamy," announces your niece, as she drools over a poster of him. "Who cares about football? I only care about his six-pack abs! Persuade Messy to focus more on modelling by offering him lucrative contracts to pose topless for roadside billboards. When people see his rippling muscles, they will not see him as a god, but as an Adonis!"
options.result: the distracting décor lining the roads causes multiple pile-ups

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "Let's end this sacrilege by enticing Messy with copious amounts of food," scoffs your uncle, stuffing his face with the biscuits on your desk. "Provide the finest food at his hotel rooms and training facilities. He'll soon turn into a portly specimen, won't be able to play the game any more and then no one will call him 'God'. Problem solved." Letting out a huge belch, he snatches your plate of scones.
options.result: a popular phrase is "eat, drink and be merry for tomorrow we eat, drink and be merry some more"

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: deadly medical pandemics
policiesAndNotabilities.name: deadly medical pandemics
